Bluetooth Diagnostics //Menu Help Connect Contact //Commands Detect Protocol GET SUPPORTED SUBFUNCTIONS GET DTC NUMBER GET DTC CODES CLEAR DTC'S Battery Voltage Help for user to understand the commands //Descriptions Description get Supported Subfunctions

This command will notify you about the supported diagnostic parameter id's in your car. This translates into real time data like: engine load, speed, coolant temperatures etc…
 
Functionality:
 1. Press the button -> The supported subfunctions will be printed.
 2. Press and hold (After initial press) -> Important real time data will be printed.
This command will print out the number of emission related DTC.

The purpose is to select this command before reading the actual dtc's to know if we will have something to read.
 This command will read the emission related DTC's from your car and display them in a human readable mode.

This is done with the help of a integrated database of DTC's inside the app.
 Commands This command will clear all the emission related DTC's.

Keep in mind that it also clears the MIL of the car and some calibration data.
 This command will detect the protocol your car is using for diagnostics like CAN, KWP2000, J1850 VPW, J1850 PWM etc…
 This command will detect the current battery voltage with an accuracy up to +-2%, without additional calibration.
 Show more Show more details PID's Description presented in Hexadecimal

02 - Freeze DTC
03 - Fuel System Status
04 - Engine Load
05-Engine Coolant Temperature
06 - Short term fuel trim-Bank 1
07 - Long term fuel trim—Bank 1
08 - Short term fuel trim—Bank 2
09 - Long term fuel trim—Bank 2
0A - Fuel pressure
0B - Intake manifold absolute pressure
0C - Engine Speed
0D - Vehicle Speed
0E - Timing advance
OF - Intake air temperature
10 - Mass air flow sensor (MAF) air flow rate
11 - Throttle position
12 - Commanded secondary air status
13 - Oxygen sensors present (in 2 banks)
14 - Oxygen Sensor 1
15 - Oxygen Sensor 2
16 - Oxygen Sensor 3
17 - Oxygen Sensor 4
18 - Oxygen Sensor 5
19 - Oxygen Sensor 6
1A - Oxygen Sensor 7
1B - Oxygen Sensor 8
1C - OBD standards this vehicle conforms to
1D - Oxygen sensors present (in 4 banks)
1E - Auxiliary input status
1F - Run time since engine start
20 - PIDs supported [$21 - $40]
 CONSOLE Insert command… Send Command Cancel Here you can send additional OBD2 commands and get the raw response.
